Sequence Information.Peptide Name: BmKn-26 (BmKn2 analog, synthetic AMPs, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: C-terminal amino acid truncation, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (53.85%) toparent peptide BmKn2I=A: 29%, others: 13%.Activity: inhibited biofilm formation of P. aeruginosa weakly.Structure: random coil in water and become helical in 30% or 70% TFE.In vitro toxicity: sheep RBC: not hemo.lytic.
Literature Information.Author: Teerapo K, Roytrakul S, Sistayanarain A, Kunthalert D. 2019
Literature Information.Title: A scorpion venom peptide derivative BmKn-22 with potent antibiofilm activity against Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
